solution.text:
Given points are : (_{i}_,_{j}_) and (_{{i+k}}_,_{{j+l}}_).
Apply distance formula :
i.e., Distance = \(\sqrt {(x_1-x_2)^2 + (y_1-y_2)^2}\)
Where, \(x_1 = _{{i+k}}_ , x_2 = _{i}_ , y_1 = _{{j+l}}_ , y_2 = _{j}_\)
Substituting the values in distance formula to find the distance between given points.
i.e., Distance = \(\sqrt {(_{{i+k}}_-_{i}_)^2 + (_{{j+l}}_-_{j}_)^2}\)
i.e., Distance = \(\sqrt {(_{k}_)^2 + (_{l}_)^2}\)
i.e., Distance = \(\sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\)
i.e., Distance = \(\sqrt {_{{pow(k,2) + pow(l,2)}}_}\)
i.e., Distance = _{m}_

content.text: Find the distance between following points: (_{i}_,_{j}_) and (_{{i+k}}_,_{{j+l}}_).
